body:
What's the use case?

On Wed, Jun 24, 2015 at 9:04 AM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> ---
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200
> Commit Summary
> - Adding util to get a NULL terminated string from a slice.
> 
> File Changes
> - _M_ include/grpc/support/slice.h
>   https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200/files#diff-0 (4)
> - _M_ src/core/support/slice.c
>   https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200/files#diff-1 (7)
> - _M_ test/core/support/slice_test.c
>   https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200/files#diff-2 (29)
> 
> Patch Links:
> - https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200.patch
> - https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200.diff
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200.

A bunch of test code where I have to print the contents of a slice.

wrote:

> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200#issuecomment-114926310.

No chance gpr_hexdump does the trick?

I worry about us missing some bad problem due to embedded nulls.

mmmm. Not really, I'd like this data to be readable by a human being...
For the embedded nulls, it's kind of the same with C++
std::string::c_str(), isn't it? There may be some in the middle but at
least you know that you have one at the end.

On Wed, Jun 24, 2015 at 6:55 PM, Craig Tiller notifications@github.com
wrote:

> No chance gpr_hexdump does the trick?
> 
> I worry about us missing some bad problem due to embedded nulls.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200#issuecomment-114940646.

So hexdump can produce both a hex string and an ASCII dump (with dots at
relavent string positions for non printables).

I'm being cautious because I've seen this go horribly wrong.

On Wed, Jun 24, 2015, 10:05 AM jboeuf notifications@github.com wrote:

> mmmm. Not really, I'd like this data to be readable by a human being...
> For the embedded nulls, it's kind of the same with C++
> std::string::c_str(), isn't it? There may be some in the middle but at
> least you know that you have one at the end.

>

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200#issuecomment-114943198.

That will look pretty bad... If you add a flag that does not produce the
hex, I could go for it (even though that would look weird hexdump(PLAINTEXT
& NO_HEX))... I'm not sure I really understand the concern here though...
Embedded nulls are a well-known issue. I can add some comments to warn that
this may be the case explicitly if that makes you feel better :).

So, a decade ago I watched an engineer\* corrupt thousands of files and stop
a team of about a hundred working for a day by not noticing that a null
terminator was being written into a file - because the debug tools we had
exhibited exactly this limitation.

It was a very bad day, and I'm keen to not repeat it.

Could you make your function crash if there's a NULL within the slice?
- not I, but as it turns out they're now another fine Googler

I certainly could but do you want to prohibit the use of c_str() as well in
C++? I frankly don't see the difference here. Enlighten me!

c_str being broken isn't an excuse for repeating mistakes

> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200#issuecomment-114951300.
Also, `std::string`'s primary purpose isn't carrying binary data.
Actually, that's what this is doing :-D

So, after discussing a bit with @ctiller, here's my stance on that:
- `gpr_hexdump` should be renamed to `gpr_dump` or `gpr_dump_slice`.
- `gpr_dump_slice` should get an enum parameter that specifies the format: `HEX` or `PLAINTEXT`.

That sounds reasonable to me.

Another thing I could do is to have a gpr_cstring_from_slice in the
non-public src/core/support/string.h and keep gpr_hexdump as is. This way
it is not in the public slice.h and hopefully that should alleviate Craig's
concerns about people abusing this function.

Let me know... Craig?

wrote:

> So, after discussing a bit with @ctiller https://github.com/ctiller,

>

> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/2200#issuecomment-115016968.
I think a general gpr_dump_{buffer,slice} taking some options flags sounds like a really fantastic thing actually.
Maybe while y'all are at it, address #2111?

@soltanmm - I think that's a different topic.

How do you like it now?

```
src/core/transport/chttp2_transport.c: In function 'grpc_chttp2_add_incoming_goaway':
src/core/transport/chttp2_transport.c:555:3: error: implicit declaration of function 'gpr_hexdump' [-Werror=implicit-function-declaration]
   char *msg = gpr_hexdump((char*)GPR_SLICE_START_PTR(goaway_text), GPR_SLICE_LENGTH(goaway_text), GPR_HEXDUMP_PLAINTEXT);
   ^
src/core/transport/chttp2_transport.c:555:99: error: 'GPR_HEXDUMP_PLAINTEXT' undeclared (first use in this function)
   char *msg = gpr_hexdump((char*)GPR_SLICE_START_PTR(goaway_text), GPR_SLICE_LENGTH(goaway_text), GPR_HEXDUMP_PLAINTEXT);
                                                                                                   ^
```
Merged and fixed.
Anyone wants to merge this?
